title: When ideas have sex
excerpt: At TEDGlobal 2010, author Matt Ridley shows how, throughout history, the engine of human progress has been the meeting and mating of ideas to make new ideas. It's not important how clever individuals are, he says; what really matters is how smart the collective brain is.

title: The World Is Full of Sleeping Beauties
excerpt: Success in nature and culture depends just as much on timing as it does on brilliance.

title: Women’s Basketball Continues Slump
excerpt: SB Loses Shootout to Manhattan On Nov. 24 Stony Brook’s Women’s Basketball team faced the Manhattan Jasper’s. In a high scoring affair, Stony Brook lost by a final score of 74-68. The Jasper’s held the lead most of the game, including a game high 12 point lead at half (44-32).

title: Should You Invest in Disruptive Materials?

title: The Key to Successful Innovation? Progress Over Product
excerpt: Tap into people's unspoken needs to create breakthrough innovations.

title: The Stories Behind 20 Inventions That Changed the World
excerpt: From blood banks and barcodes to the Super Soaker and the pizza box, here are the fascinating stories behind inventions that changed the world.
